page.title: 07MAMMALS
page.content: In our area there are many different species of wild mammals.The most obvious are the{rabbits}which roam around the links in their hundreds. Another mammal which we see quite a lot of is the{hedgehog,}but many are killed in crossing the road. Hedgehogs were introduced less than ten years ago.There are plenty of{rats}roaming around; they spend most of the winter in barns of straw and hay with their relation, the{house mouse. Woodmice and{Orkney voles}are lurking around and some scientists believe that Sanday has its own sub-species. There are dozens of{Atlantic (grey) seals and{common seals}also.They are mostly found near the rocky coasts of the Holms of Ire. Occasionaly{whales}are seen in the shallow waters around our coast.A 17-metre male{Sperm whale}was stranded at Backaskaill Bay in 1984.
